page.title: 16ARBROATH FOOTBALL CLUB
page.content: Arbroath Football Club are semi professional and play in the Scottish league,division 2.Last season they finished bottom of the league,a fact which makes them the poorest senior side in Scotland.This fact was reflected at the turnstiles.Normally fewer than 500 of the{population} turned up to watch them whereas 10 years ago crowds of 2000 to 3000 used to watch The Red Lichties.Even allowing for changes in the{life {style}of the average fan things have seldom been bleaker.Their position is very ironic because 1985 happens to be the centenary year of the clubs most famous feat:a piece of{local history {unlikely}to be beaten.In 1885 they beat Aberdeen Bon Accord 36-0 in a Scottish Cup game,and one man,John Petrie,scored 13 goals himself.
